ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
ygData.msgSnippet: ... And what did the guide say after you petitioned this lack of sharing? This doesn t follow the play nice policy at all. I wouldn t let anyone walk over me
ygData.messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Harmonie Moonsong [mailto:harmoniemoonsong@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 17, 2000 5:50 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Worldly Issues & "Play Nice"
>
>
> From: Harmonie Moonsong <harmoniemoonsong@...>
>
> On the topic of playing nice,,, last night my almost
> 17lvl enchanter was trying to kill gnolls in highpass
> with a 19 druid for a partner. We were doing fine,
> till this Lvl 50 Necro arrived and said... "sorry to
> do this to you guys, but i need the faction" he then
> proceeded to kill everything in site till i gave up
> and left 30 minutes later. That is in reallity how
> sharing works...

And what did the guide say after you petitioned this lack of sharing?

This doesn't follow the "play nice" policy at all.

I wouldn't let anyone walk over me regardless of their level. If I can't
convince them to share, then I'd petition Verant and wait.

The other thing I'd do is contact the person's guildmaster to find out if
this is an acceptable form of behavior from a guild member. I've been
fortunate to talk to several guildmasters who have reigned in one of theirs
after a complaint.

BTW, what level do enchanters get charm? Couldn't you have charmed the
creatures away from him, worse comes to worse?

Windleaf
